com.conductor.kafka.hadoop
Class MultipleKafkaInputFormat

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputFormat<LongWritable,BytesWritable>
      com.conductor.kafka.hadoop.MultipleKafkaInputFormat

public class MultipleKafkaInputFormat
extends InputFormat<LongWritable,BytesWritable>

A InputFormat that can read any number of Kafka queues in a single Job.

Note, you MUST use DelegatingMapper when setting Job.setMapperClass(Class) in order for this InputFormat work. This is set for you every time you call addTopic(Job, String, String, Class), but be sure not to override it!

This class may be used safely in combination with MultipleInputs.

Author:
Casey Green
See Also:
KafkaInputFormat, KafkaInputSplit, KafkaRecordReader

getTopics

public static List<MultipleKafkaInputFormat.TopicConf> getTopics(Configuration conf)
Returns a List containing all of the topic-group-Mapper combinations added via addTopic(Job, String, String, Class).

Parameters:

Returns:
all of the configured MultipleKafkaInputFormat.TopicConfs

addTopic

public static void addTopic(Job job,
                            String topic,
                            String consumerGroup,
                            Class<? extends Mapper> mapperClass)
Adds a topic input that will be read with the provided mapperClass. This method also sets the job-level mapper (Job.setMapperClass(Class)) to DelegatingMapper, which is required for this input format to work, so do not override this!

Note that you can read the same topic using any number of Mappers, same of different. Although odd, it is possible to read the same queue with the same Mapper.

Parameters:
job - the job
topic - the topic to read
consumerGroup - the consumer group for this particular input configuration.
mapperClass - the mapper class that will read the topic
